summary.long: John is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This one was in the beginning with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things came into being through him, and apart from him not one thing came into being that has come into being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In him was life, and the life was the light of humanity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the light shines in the darkness, and the darkness did not overcome it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man came, sent from God, whose name was John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This one came for a witness, in order that he could testify about the light, so that all would believe through him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That one was not the light, but came in order that he could testify about the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The true light, who gives light to every person, was coming into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was in the world, and the world came into being through him, and the world did not recognize him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to his own things, and his own people did not receive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as many as received him—to those who believe in his name—he gave to them authority to become children of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who were born not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of a husband, but of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Word became flesh and took up residence among us, and we saw his glory, glory as of the one and only from the Father, full of grace and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John testified about him and cried out, saying, “This one was he about whom I said, ‘The one who comes after me is ahead of me, because he existed before me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For from his fullness we have all received, and grace after grace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the law was given through Moses; grace and truth came about through Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one has seen God at any time; the one and only, God, the one who is in the bosom of the Father—that one has made him known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem so that they could ask him, “Who are you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he confessed—and he did not deny, and confessed—“I am not the Christ!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked him, “Then who are you? Are you Elijah?” And he said, “I am not!” “Are you the Prophet?” And he answered, “No!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to him, “Who are you, so that we can give an answer to those who sent us? What do you say about yourself?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said,
“I am ‘the voice of one crying out in the wilderness,
    “Make straight the way of the Lord,”’
just as Isaiah the prophet said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (And they had been sent from the Pharisees.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked him and said to him, “Why then are you baptizing, if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered them, saying, “I baptize with water. In your midst stands one whom you do not know—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the one who comes after me, of whom I am not worthy to untie the strap of his sandal!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things took place in Bethany on the other side of the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day he saw Jesus coming to him and said, “Look! The Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This one is the one about whom I said, ‘After me is coming a man who is ahead of me, because he existed before me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I did not know him, but in order that he could be revealed to Israel, because of this I came baptizing with water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And John testified, saying, “I have seen the Spirit descending like a dove from heaven and remaining upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I did not know him, but the one who sent me to baptize with water, that one said to me, ‘The one upon whom you see the Spirit descending and remaining upon him—this one is the one who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have seen and testify that this one is the Chosen One of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day again John was standing there, and two of his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and looking at Jesus as he was walking by, he said, “Look! The Lamb of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the two disciples heard him speaking, and they followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus, turning around and seeing them following him, said to them, “What do you seek?” And they said to him, “Rabbi” (which means when translated “Teacher”), “where are you staying?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He said to them, “Come and you will see!” So they came and saw where he was staying, and they stayed with him that day (it was about the tenth hour).
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, was one of the two who heard John and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This one first found his own brother Simon and said to him, “We have found the Messiah!” (which is translated “Christ”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought him to Jesus. Looking at him, Jesus said, “You are Simon the son of John. You will be called Cephas” (which is interpreted “Peter”).
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: On the next day he wanted to depart for Galilee, and he found Philip. And Jesus said to him, “Follow me!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: (Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the town of Andrew and Peter.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found the one whom Moses wrote about in the law, and the prophets wrote about—Jesus son of Joseph from Nazareth!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nathanael said to him, “Can anything good come out of Nazareth?” Philip said to him, “Come and see!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward him and said about him, “Look! A true Israelite in whom is no deceit!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nathanael said to him, “From where do you know me?” Jesus answered and said to him, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nathanael answered him, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God! You are the king of Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to him, “Because I said to you that I saw you under the fig tree, do you believe? You will see greater things than these!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he said to him, “Truly, truly I say to all of you, you will see heaven opened and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of Man.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And on the third day, there was a wedding at Cana in Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And both Jesus and his disciples were invited to the wedding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the wine ran out, the mother of Jesus said to him, “They have no wine!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to her, “What does your concern have to do with me, woman? My hour has not yet come.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: His mother said to the servants, “Whatever he says to you, do it!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now six stone water jars were set there, in accordance with the ceremonial cleansing of the Jews, each holding two or three measures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Fill the water jars with water.” And they filled them to the brim.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he said to them, “Now draw some out and take it to the head steward. So they took it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now when the head steward tasted the water which had become wine and did not know where it was from—but the servants who had drawn the water knew—the head steward summoned the bridegroom
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, “Everyone serves the good wine first, and whenever they are drunk, the inferior. You have kept the good wine until now!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: This beginning of signs Jesus performed at Cana in Galilee, and revealed his glory, and his disciples believed in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this he went down to Capernaum, and his mother and brothers and his disciples, and they stayed there a few days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Passover of the Jews was near, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he found in the temple courts those who were selling oxen and sheep and doves, and the money changers seated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made a whip of cords and drove them all out of the temple courts, both the sheep and the oxen, and he poured out the coins of the money changers and overturned their tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to the ones selling the doves he said, “Take these things away from here! Do not make my Father’s house a marketplace!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: His disciples remembered that it is written, “Zeal for your house will consume me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jews answered and said to him, “What sign do you show to us, because you are doing these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the Jews said, “This temple has been under construction forty-six years, and will you raise it up in three days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he was speaking about the temple of his body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this, and they believed the scripture and the saying that Jesus had spoken.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now while he was in Jerusalem at the Passover, during the feast, many believed in his name because they saw his signs which he was doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus himself did not entrust himself to them, because he knew all people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and because he did not need anyone to testify about man, for he himself knew what was in man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a man of the Pharisees whose name was Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man came to him at night and said to him, “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher who has come from God, for no one is able to perform these signs that you are performing unless God were with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to him, “Truly, truly I say to you, unless someone is born from above, he is not able to see the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nicodemus said to him, “How can a man be born when he is an old man? He is not able to enter into his mother’s womb for the second time and be born, can he?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Truly, truly I say to you, unless someone is born of water and spirit, he is not able to enter into the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: What is born of the flesh is flesh, and what is born of the Spirit is spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be astonished that I said to you, ‘It is necessary for you to be born from above.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The wind blows wherever it wishes, and you hear the sound of it, but you do not know where it comes from and where it is going. So is everyone who is born of the Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nicodemus answered and said to him, “How can these things be?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to him, “Are you the teacher of Israel, and you do not understand these things?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, we speak what we know, and we testify about what we have seen, and you do not accept our testimony!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If I tell you earthly things and you do not believe, how will you believe if I tell you heavenly things?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And no one has ascended into heaven except the one who descended from heaven—the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And just as Moses lifted up the snake in the wilderness, thus it is necessary that the Son of Man be lifted up,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: so that everyone who believes in him will have eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For in this way God loved the world, so that he gave his one and only Son, in order that everyone who believes in him will not perish, but will have eternal life.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For God did not send his Son into the world in order that he should judge the world, but in order that the world should be saved through him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who believes in him is not judged, but the one who does not believe has already been judged, because he has not believed in the name of the one and only Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And this is the judgment: that the light has come into the world, and people loved the darkness rather than the light, because their deeds were evil.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For everyone who practices evil hates the light and does not come to the light, lest his deeds be exposed.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the one who practices the truth comes to the light, in order that his deeds may be revealed, that they are done in God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: After these things Jesus and his disciples came into Judean territory, and there he spent time with them and was baptizing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now John was also baptizing at Aenon near Salim, because water was plentiful there, and they were coming and were being baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For John had not yet been thrown into prison.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So a dispute occurred on the part of John’s disciples with a Jew concerning purification.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, he who was with you on the other side of the Jordan, about whom you testified—look, this one is baptizing, and all are coming to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered and said, “A man can receive not one thing unless it is granted to him from heaven!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You yourselves testify about me that I said, ‘I am not the Christ, but I am sent before that one.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who has the bride is the bridegroom. But the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice. So this joy of mine is complete.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: It is necessary for that one to increase, but for me to decrease.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who comes from above is over all. The one who is from the earth is from the earth and speaks from the earth; the one who comes from heaven is over all.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: What he has seen and heard, this he testifies, and no one accepts his testimony.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who accepts his testimony has attested that God is true.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For the one whom God sent speaks the words of God, for he does not give the Spirit by measure.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The Father loves the Son and has given all things into his hand.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who believes in the Son has eternal life, but the one who disobeys the Son will not see life—but the wrath of God remains on him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now when Jesus knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (although Jesus himself was not baptizing, but his disciples),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he left Judea and departed again for Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was necessary for him to go through Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he came to a town of Samaria called Sychar, near the piece of land that Jacob had given to his son Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob’s well was there, so Jesus, because he had become tired from the journey, simply sat down at the well. It was about the sixth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman of Samaria came to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give me water to drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For his disciples had gone away into the town so that they could buy food.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Samaritan woman said to him, “How do you, being a Jew, ask from me water to drink, since I am a Samaritan woman?” (For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to her, “If you had known the gift of God and who it is who says to you, ‘Give me water to drink,’ you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to him, “Sir, you have no bucket and the well is deep! From where then do you get this living water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not greater than our father Jacob, are you, who gave us the well and drank from it himself, and his sons and his livestock?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to her, “Everyone who drinks of this water will be thirsty again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whoever drinks of this water which I will give to him will never be thirsty for eternity, but the water which I will give to him will become in him a well of water springing up to eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to him, “Sir, give me this water, so that I will not be thirsty or come here to draw water!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to her, “Go, call your husband and come here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman answered and said to him, “I do not have a husband.” Jesus said to her, “You have said rightly, ‘I do not have a husband,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you have had five husbands, and the one whom you have now is not your husband; this you have said truthfully!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to him, “Sir, I see that you are a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, and you people say that in Jerusalem is the place where it is necessary to worship.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Believe me, woman, that an hour is coming when neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem will you worship the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You worship what you do not know. We worship what we know, because salvation is from the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But an hour is coming—and now is here—when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for indeed the Father seeks such people to be his worshipers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is spirit, and the ones who worship him must worship in spirit and truth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to him, “I know that Messiah is coming” (the one called Christ); “whenever that one comes, he will proclaim all things to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “I, the one speaking to you, am he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at this point his disciples came, and they were astonished that he was speaking with a woman. However, no one said, “What do you seek?” or “Why are you speaking with her?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the woman left her water jar and went away into the town and said to the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come, see a man who told me everything I have ever done! Perhaps this one is the Christ?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out from the town and were coming to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the meanwhile the disciples were asking him, saying, “Rabbi, eat something!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “I have food to eat that you do not know about.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the disciples began to say to one another, “No one brought him anything to eat, did they?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “My food is that I do the will of the one who sent me and complete his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not say, ‘There are yet four months and the harvest comes’? Behold, I say to you, lift up your eyes and look at the fields, that they are white for harvest already.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who reaps receives wages and gathers fruit for eternal life, in order that the one who sows and the one who reaps can rejoice together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in this instance the saying is true, ‘It is one who sows and another who reaps.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I sent you to reap what you did not work for; others have worked, and you have entered into their work.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now from that town many of the Samaritans believed in him because of the word of the woman who testified, “He told me everything that I have done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the Samaritans came to him, they began asking him to stay with them. And he stayed there two days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many more believed because of his word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were saying to the woman, “No longer because of what you said do we believe, for we ourselves have heard, and we know that this one is truly the Savior of the world!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the two days he departed from there into Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jesus himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own homeland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when he came to Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him, because they had seen all the things he had done in Jerusalem at the feast (for they themselves had also come to the feast).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he came again to Cana in Galilee, where he had made the water wine. And there was at Capernaum a certain royal official whose son was sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man, when he heard that Jesus had come from Judea into Galilee, went to him and asked that he come down and heal his son, for he was about to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to him, “Unless you people see signs and wonders, you will never believe!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The royal official said to him, “Sir, come down before my child dies!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Go, your son will live.” The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him, and he departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as he was going down, his slaves met him, saying that his child was alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he inquired from them the hour at which he had gotten better. Then they said to him, “Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the father knew that it was that same hour at which Jesus said to him, “Your son will live,” and he himself believed, and his whole household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is again a second sign Jesus performed when he came from Judea into Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there is in Jerusalem near the Sheep Gate a pool called in Aramaic Bethzatha, which has five porticoes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In these were lying a large number of those who were sick, blind, lame, paralyzed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain man was there who had been thirty-eight years in his sickness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, when he saw this one lying there and knew that he had been sick a long time already, said to him, “Do you want to become well?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who was sick answered him, “Sir, I do not have anyone that, whenever the water is stirred up, could put me into the pool. But while I am coming, another goes down before me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Get up! Pick up your mat and walk!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately the man became well and picked up his mat and began to walk. (Now it was the Sabbath on that day.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jews were saying to the one who had been healed, “It is the Sabbath, and it is not permitted for you to pick up the mat!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered them, “The one who made me well—that one said to me, ‘Pick up your mat and walk!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they asked him, “Who is the man who said to you, ‘Pick up your mat and walk?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who was healed did not know who it was, for Jesus had withdrawn while a crowd was in the place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things Jesus found him at the temple and said to him, “Look, you have become well! Sin no longer, lest something worse happen to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man went and reported to the Jews that Jesus was the one who made him well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on account of this the Jews began to persecute Jesus, because he was doing these things on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered them, “My Father is working until now, and I am working.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So on account of this the Jews were seeking even more to kill him, because he not only was breaking the Sabbath, but also was calling God his own Father, thus making himself equal with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus answered and said to them, “Truly, truly I say to you, the Son can do nothing from himself except what he sees the Father doing. For whatever that one does, these things also the Son does likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Father loves the Son and shows him everything that he himself is doing. And greater works than these he will show him, so that you will be astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as the Father raises the dead and makes them alive, thus also the Son makes alive whomever he wishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Father does not judge anyone, but he has given all judgment to the Son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order that all people will honor the Son, just as they honor the Father. The one who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you that the one who hears my word and who believes the one who sent me has eternal life, and does not come into judgment, but has passed from death into life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Truly, truly I say to you, that an hour is coming—and now is here—when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God, and the ones who hear will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as the Father has life in himself, thus also he has granted to the Son to have life in himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he has granted him authority to carry out judgment, because he is the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not be astonished at this, because an hour is coming in which all those in the tombs will hear his voice
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will come out—those who have done good things to a resurrection of life, but those who have practiced evil things to a resurrection of judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am able to do nothing from myself. Just as I hear, I judge, and my judgment is just, because I do not seek my own will, but the will of the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I testify about myself, my testimony is not true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is another who testifies about me, and I know that the testimony which he testifies about me is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have sent to John and he has testified to the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (And I do not receive testimony from people, but I say these things in order that you may be saved.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That one was the lamp which was burning and shining, and you wanted to rejoice for an hour in his light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I have a testimony greater than John’s, for the works which the Father has given to me that I should complete them—the very works which I am doing—these testify about me, that the Father has sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Father who sent me, that one has testified about me. You have neither heard his voice at any time nor seen his form.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you do not have his word residing in yourselves, because the one whom that one sent, in this one you do not believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You search the scriptures because you think that you have eternal life in them, and it is these that testify about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you are not willing to come to me so that you may have life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I do not accept glory from people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I know you, that you do not have the love of God in yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have come in my Father’s name, and you do not accept me. If another should come in his own name, you would accept that one!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How are you able to believe, if you accept glory from one another, and do not seek the glory which is from the only God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not think that I will accuse you before the Father! The one who accuses you is Moses, in whom you have put your hope!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you had believed Moses, you would believe me, for that one wrote about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not believe that one’s writings, how will you believe my words?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things Jesus went away to the other side of the sea of Galilee (that is, Tiberias).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a large crowd was following him because they were observing the signs that he was doing on those who were sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus went up on the mountain and sat down there with his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now the Passover, the feast of the Jews, was near.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, when he looked up and saw that a large crowd was coming to him, said to Philip, “Where can we buy bread so that these people can eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now he said this to test him, because he knew what he was going to do.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip replied to him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread would not be enough for them, in order that each one could receive a little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of his disciples, Andrew the brother of Simon Peter, said to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Here is a boy who has five barley loaves and two fish, but what are these for so many people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Make the people recline.” (Now there was a lot of grass in the place.) So the men reclined, approximately five thousand in number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus took the bread, and after he had given thanks, he distributed it to those who were reclining—likewise also of the fish, as much as they wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were satisfied, he said to his disciples, “Gather the remaining fragments so that nothing is lost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they gathered them, and filled twelve baskets with fragments from the five barley loaves which were left over by those who had eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the people saw the sign that he performed, they began to say, “This one is truly the Prophet who is to come into the world!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, because he knew that they were about to come and seize him in order to make him king, withdrew again up the mountain by himself alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when evening came, his disciples went down to the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And getting into a boat, they began to go to the other side of the sea, to Capernaum. And it had already become dark, and Jesus had not yet come to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sea began to be stirred up because a strong wind was blowing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when they had rowed about twenty-five or thirty stadia, they saw Jesus walking on the sea and coming near the boat, and they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “It is I! Do not be afraid!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they were wanting to take him into the boat, and immediately the boat came to the land to which they were going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day, the crowd that was on the other side of the sea saw that other boats were not there (except one), and that Jesus had not entered with his disciples into the boat, but his disciples had departed alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other boats from Tiberias came near the place where they had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the crowd saw that Jesus was not there, nor his disciples, they themselves got into the boats and came to Capernaum seeking Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they found him on the other side of the sea, they said to him, “Rabbi, when did you get here?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied to them and said, “Truly, truly I say to you, you seek me not because you saw signs, but because you ate of the loaves and were satisfied!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not work for the food that perishes, but the food that remains to eternal life, which the Son of Man will give to you. For God the Father has set his seal on this one.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to him, “What shall we do that we can accomplish the works of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them, “This is the work of God: that you believe in the one whom that one sent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to him, “Then what sign will you perform, so that we can see it and believe you? What will you do?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, just as it is written, ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly I say to you, Moses did not give you bread from heaven, but my Father is giving you the true bread from heaven!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the bread of God is the one who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to him, “Sir, always give us this bread!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. The one who comes to me will never be hungry, and the one who believes in me will never be thirsty again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I said to you that you have seen me and do not believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone whom the Father gives to me will come to me, and the one who comes to me I will never throw out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I have come down from heaven not that I should do my will, but the will of the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is the will of the one who sent me: that everyone whom he has given me, I would not lose any of them, but raise them up on the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is the will of my Father, that everyone who looks at the Son and believes in him would have eternal life, and I will raise him up on the last day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Jews began to grumble about him because he said, “I am the bread that came down from heaven,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were saying, “Is this one not Jesus the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How does he now say, ‘I have come down from heaven’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them, “Do not grumble among yourselves!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one is able to come to me unless the Father who sent me draws him, and I will raise him up on the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is written in the prophets, ‘And they will all be taught by God.’ Everyone who hears from the Father and learns comes to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Not that anyone has seen the Father except the one who is from God—this one has seen the Father.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, the one who believes has eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the bread of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness and they died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the bread that comes down from heaven so that someone may eat from it and not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the living bread that came down from heaven. If anyone eats from this bread, he will live forever. And the bread that I will give for the life of the world is my flesh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jews began to quarrel among themselves, saying, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you do not have life in yourselves!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up on the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who eats my flesh and drinks my blood resides in me and I in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as the living Father sent me, and I live because of the Father, so also the one who eats me—that one will live because of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the bread that came down from heaven, not as the fathers ate and died. The one who eats this bread will live forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said these things while teaching in the synagogue in Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus many of his disciples, when they heard it, said, “This saying is hard! Who can understand it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, because he knew within himself that his disciples were grumbling about this, said to them, “Does this cause you to be offended?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then what if you see the Son of Man ascending where he was before?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit is the one who gives life; the flesh profits nothing. The words that I have spoken to you are spirit and are life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there are some of you who do not believe.” (For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who did not believe, and who it was who would betray him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Because of this I said to you that no one can come to me unless it has been granted to him by the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason many of his disciples drew back and were not walking with him any longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to the twelve, “You do not want to go away also, do you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter answered him, “Lord, to whom would we go? You have the words of eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we have believed, and have come to know, that you are the Holy One of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied to them, “Did I not choose you, the twelve, and one of you is the devil?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now he was speaking about Judas son of Simon Iscariot, because this one—one of the twelve—was going to betray him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after these things Jesus was going about in Galilee. For he did not want to go about in Judea, because the Jews were seeking to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the feast of the Jews—the feast of Tabernacles—was near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So his brothers said to him, “Depart from here and go to Judea, so that your disciples also can see your works that you are doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For no one does anything in secret and yet he himself desires to be publicly recognized. If you are doing these things, reveal yourself to the world!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For not even his brothers believed in him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to them, “My time has not yet come, but your time is always ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The world cannot hate you, but it hates me, because I am testifying about it, that its deeds are evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You go up to the feast. I am not going up to this feast, because my time is not yet completed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had said these things, he remained in Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when his brothers had gone up to the feast, then he also went up, not openly, but (as it were) in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jews were looking for him at the feast, and were saying, “Where is he?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a lot of grumbling concerning him among the crowds; some were saying, “He is a good man,” but others were saying, “No, but he deceives the crowd.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, no one was speaking openly about him for fear of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the feast was already half over, Jesus went to the temple courts and began to teach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews were astonished, saying, “How does this man possess knowledge, because he has not been taught?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus answered them and said, “My teaching is not mine, but is from the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone wants to do his will, he will know about my teaching, whether it is from God or I am speaking from myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who speaks from himself seeks his own glory. But the one who seeks the glory of the one who sent him—this one is true, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has not Moses given you the law, and none of you carries out the law? Why do you seek to kill me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd replied, “You have a demon! Who is seeking to kill you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them, “I performed one work, and you are all astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this Moses has given you circumcision (not that it is from Moses, but from the fathers), and you circumcise a man on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath so that the law of Moses would not be broken, are you angry with me because I made a whole man well on the Sabbath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not judge according to outward appearance, but judge according to righteous judgment!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the inhabitants of Jerusalem began to say, “Is this not the one whom they are seeking to kill?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, he is speaking openly and they are saying nothing to him! Can it be that the rulers truly know that this man is the Christ?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet we know where this man is from, but the Christ, whenever he comes—no one knows where he is from!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus cried out in the temple courts, teaching and saying, “You both know me and you know where I am from! And I have not come from myself, but the one who sent me is true, whom you do not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know him, because I am from him and he sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they were seeking to seize him, and no one laid a hand on him, because his hour had not yet come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from the crowd many believed in him and were saying, “Whenever the Christ comes, he will not perform more signs than this man has done, will he?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees heard the crowd murmuring these things about him, and the chief priests and the Pharisees sent officers in order to take him into custody .
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “Yet a little time I am with you, and I am going to the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will seek me and will not find me, and where I am, you cannot come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jews said to one another, “Where is this one going to go, that we will not find him? He is not going to go to the Dispersion among the Greeks and teach the Greeks, is he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is this saying that he said, ‘You will seek me and will not find me, and where I am, you cannot come’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the last day of the feast—the great day—Jesus stood and cried out, saying, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to me, and let him drink,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the one who believes in me. Just as the scripture said, ‘Out of his belly will flow rivers of living water.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he said this concerning the Spirit, whom those who believed in him were about to receive. For the Spirit was not yet given, because Jesus had not yet been glorified.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, when they heard these words, some from the crowd began to say, “This man is truly the Prophet!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others were saying, “This man is the Christ!” But others were saying, “No, for the Christ does not come from Galilee, does he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has not the scripture said that the Christ comes from the descendants of David, and from Bethlehem, the village where David was?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there was a division in the crowd because of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of them were wanting to seize him, but no one laid hands on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the officers came to the chief priests and Pharisees. And they said to them, “Why did you not bring him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officers replied, “Never has a man spoken like this!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees replied to them, “You have not also been deceived, have you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the rulers or of the Pharisees have believed in him, have they?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this crowd who does not know the law is accursed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nicodemus, the one who came to him previously—who was one of them—said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Our law does not condemn a man unless it first hears from him and knows what he is doing, does it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered and said to him, “You are not also from Galilee, are you? Investigate and see that a prophet does not arise from Galilee!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And each one went to his own house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now early in the morning he came again to the temple courts. And all the people were coming, and he sat down and began to teach them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the scribes and the Pharisees brought to him a woman caught in adultery. And standing her in their midst,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they said to him, testing him, “Teacher, this woman was caught in the very act of committing adultery!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the law, Moses commanded us to stone such women. So what do you say?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now they were saying this to test him, so that they would have an occasion to bring charges against him.) But Jesus, bending down, began to write with his finger on the ground, taking no notice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they persisted in asking him, straightening up he said to them, “The one of you without sin, let him throw the first stone at her!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And bending down again, he wrote on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they heard it, being convicted by their conscience, they began to depart, one by one, beginning with the older ones, and Jesus was left alone—and the woman who was in their midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus, straightening up and seeing no one except the woman, said to her, “Where are those accusers of yours? Does no one condemn you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said, “No one, Lord.” So Jesus said, “Neither do I condemn you. Go, and sin no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus spoke to them again, saying, “I am the light of the world! The one who follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Pharisees said to him, “You testify concerning yourself! Your testimony is not true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them, “Even if I testify concerning myself, my testimony is true, because I know where I have come from and where I am going. But you do not know where I have come from or where I am going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You judge according to externals; I do not judge anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even if I judge, my judgment is true, because I am not alone, but I and the Father who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even in your law it is written that the testimony of two men is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the one who testifies concerning myself, and the Father who sent me testifies concerning me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they were saying to him, “Where is your father?” Jesus replied, “You know neither me nor my Father! If you had known me, you would have known my Father also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke these words by the treasury while teaching in the temple courts, and no one seized him, because his hour had not yet come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to them again, “I am going away, and you will seek me and will die in your sin. Where I am going you cannot come!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews began to say, “Perhaps he will kill himself, because he is saying, ‘Where I am going you cannot come.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “You are from below; I am from above. You are from this world; I am not from this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus I said to you that you will die in your sins. For if you do not believe that I am he, you will die in your sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they began to say to him, “Who are you?” Jesus said to them, “What I have been saying to you from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have many things to say and to judge concerning you, but the one who sent me is true, and the things which I heard from him, these things I say to the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (They did not know that he was speaking to them about the Father.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will recognize that I am he, and I do nothing from myself, but just as the Father taught me, I say these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who sent me is with me. He has not left me alone, because I always do the things that are pleasing to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was saying these things, many believed in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to those Jews who had believed him, “If you continue in my word you are truly my disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They replied to him, “We are descendants of Abraham and have not been enslaved to anyone at any time. How do you say, ‘You will become free’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied to them, “Truly, truly I say to you, that everyone who commits sin is a slave of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the slave does not remain in the household forever; the son remains forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if the son sets you free, you will be truly free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know that you are descendants of Abraham. But you are seeking to kill me, because my word makes no progress among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I speak the things that I have seen with the Father; so also you do the things that you have heard from the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered and said to him, “Abraham is our father!” Jesus said to them, “If you are children of Abraham, do the deeds of Abraham!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now you are seeking to kill me, a man who spoke to you the truth which I heard from God. This Abraham did not do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are doing the deeds of your father!”
They said to him, “We were not born from sexual immorality! We have one father, God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “If God were your father, you would love me, for I have come forth from God and have come. For I have not come from myself, but that one sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you not understand my way of speaking? Because you are not able to listen to my message.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are of your father the devil, and you want to do the desires of your father! That one was a murderer from the beginning, and does not stand firm in the truth, because truth is not in him. Whenever he speaks the lie, he speaks from his own nature, because he is a liar and the father of lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because I am telling the truth, you do not believe me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who among you convicts me concerning sin? If I am telling the truth, why do you not believe me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who is from God listens to the words of God. Because of this you do not listen—because you are not of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews answered and said to him, “Do we not correctly say that you are a Samaritan and have a demon?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I do not have a demon, but I honor my Father, and you dishonor me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I do not seek my own glory. There is one who seeks and judges!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, if anyone keeps my word, he will never experience death forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews said to him, “Now we know that you have a demon! Abraham and the prophets died, and you say, ‘If anyone keeps my word, he will never taste death forever.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not greater than our father Abraham who died, are you? And the prophets died! Who do you make yourself to be?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “If I glorify myself, my glory is nothing. The one who glorifies me is my Father, about whom you say, ‘He is our God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you have not known him, but I know him. And if I were to say that I do not know him, I would be a liar like you! But I know him and I keep his word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham your father rejoiced that he would see my day, and he saw it and was glad.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jews said to him, “You are not yet fifty years old, and have you seen Abraham?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly I say to you, before Abraham was, I am!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they picked up stones in order to throw them at him. But Jesus was hidden and went out of the temple courts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he went away, he saw a man blind from birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his disciples asked him, saying, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he should be born blind?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Neither this man sinned nor his parents, but it happened so that the works of God could be revealed in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is necessary for us to do the deeds of the one who sent me while it is day; night is coming, when no one can work!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had said these things, he spat on the ground and made clay with the saliva, and smeared the clay on his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “Go, wash in the pool of Siloam” (which is translated “sent”). So he went and washed and came back seeing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the neighbors and those who saw him previously (because he was a beggar) began to say, “Is this man not the one who used to sit and beg?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others were saying, “It is this man”; others were saying, “No, but he is like him.” That one was saying, “I am he!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they began to say to him, “How were your eyes opened?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “The man who is called Jesus made clay and smeared it on my eyes and said to me, ‘Go to Siloam and wash!’ So I went, and I washed, and I received sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “Where is that man?” He said, “I do not know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought him—the one formerly blind—to the Pharisees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now the day on which Jesus made the clay and opened his eyes was the Sabbath.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Pharisees also were asking him again how he received sight. And he said to them, “He put clay on my eyes, and I washed, and I see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So some of the Pharisees were saying, “This man is not from God, because he does not observe the Sabbath!” Others were saying, “How can a man who is a sinner perform such signs?” And there was a division among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to the blind man again, “What do you say about him, because he opened your eyes?” And he said, “He is a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jews did not believe concerning him that he had been blind and received sight, until they summoned the parents of the one who received sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked them, saying, “Is this man your son, whom you say was born blind? Then how does he now see?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So his parents answered and said, “We know that this man is our son, and that he was born blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But how he now sees we do not know, or who opened his eyes we do not know. Ask him! He is a mature adult; he will speak for himself!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (His parents said these things because they were afraid of the Jews, for the Jews had already decided that if anyone should confess him to be Christ, he would be expelled from the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this his parents said, “He is a mature adult; ask him.”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they summoned the man who had been blind for the second time and said to him, “Give glory to God! We know that this man is a sinner!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then that man replied, “Whether he is a sinner I do not know. One thing I know—that although I was blind, now I see!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to him, “What did he do to you? How did he open your eyes?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied to them, “I told you already and you did not listen! Why do you want to hear it again? You do not want to become his disciples also, do you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They reviled him and said, “You are his disciple! But we are disciples of Moses!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that God has spoken to Moses, but we do not know where this man is from.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man answered and said to them, “For the remarkable thing is this, that you do not know where he is from, and he opened my eyes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that God does not listen to sinners, but if someone is devout and does his will, he listens to this one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From time immemorial it has not been heard that someone opened the eyes of one born blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If this man were not from God, he would not be able to do anything!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered and said to him, “You were born completely in sin, and are you attempting to teach us?” And they threw him out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, and finding him, he said, “Do you believe in the Son of Man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said, “And who is he, sir, that I may believe in him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “You have both seen him, and he is the one who is speaking with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “I believe, Lord!” and he worshiped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, “For judgment I have come into this world, so that those who do not see may see, and those who see may become blind!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Pharisees who were with him heard these things and said to him, “We are not also blind, are we?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “If you were blind, you would not have sin. But now you say, ‘We see,’ your sin remains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Truly, truly I say to you, the one who does not enter through the door into the fold of the sheep, but climbs up at some other place—that one is a thief and a robber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who enters through the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this one the doorkeeper opens, and the sheep hear his voice, and he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever he sends out all his own, he goes before them, and the sheep follow him because they know his voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will never follow a stranger, but will flee from him, because they do not know the voice of strangers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them this parable, but they did not understand what it was that he was saying to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them again, “Truly, truly, I say to you, I am the door of the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those who came before me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep do not listen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the door. If anyone enters through me, he will be saved, and will come in and will go out and will find pasture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thief comes only so that he can steal and kill and destroy; I have come so that they may have life, and have it abundantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hired hand, who is not the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, sees the wolf approaching and abandons the sheep and runs away—and the wolf seizes them and scatters them—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he is a hired hand and he is not concerned about the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the good shepherd, and I know my own, and my own know me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as the Father knows me and I know the Father, and I lay down my life for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have other sheep which are not from this fold. I must bring these also, and they will hear my voice, and they will become one flock—one shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this the Father loves me, because I lay down my life so that I may take possession of it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one takes it from me, but I lay it down voluntarily. I have authority to lay it down, and I have authority to take possession of it again. This commandment I received from my Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again there was a division among the Jews because of these words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many of them were saying, “He has a demon and is out of his mind! Why do you listen to him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others were saying, “These are not the words of one who is possessed by a demon! A demon is not able to open the eyes of the blind, is it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the feast of the Dedication took place in Jerusalem. It was winter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus was walking in the temple in the Portico of Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jews surrounded him and began to say to him, “How long will you keep us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I told you and you do not believe! The deeds that I do in the name of my Father, these testify about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you do not believe, because you are not of my sheep!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My sheep listen to my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I give them eternal life, and they will never perish forever, and no one will seize them out of my hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all, and no one can seize them from the Father’s hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Father and I are one.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews picked up stones again so that they could stone him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I have shown you many good deeds from the Father. For which one of them are you going to stone me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews answered him, “We are not going to stone you concerning a good deed, but concerning blasphemy, and because you, although you are a man, make yourself to be God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Is it not written in your law, ‘I said, “You are gods”’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he called them ‘gods’ to whom the word of God came—and the scripture cannot be broken—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: do you say about he whom the Father set apart and sent into the world, ‘You are blaspheming,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I do not do the deeds of my Father, do not believe me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I am doing them, even if you do not believe me, believe the deeds, so that you may know and understand that the Father is in me and I am in the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they were seeking again to seize him, and he departed out of their hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went away again on the other side of the Jordan, to the place where John was baptizing at an earlier time, and he stayed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many came to him and began to say, “John performed no sign, but everything John said about this man was true!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many believed in him there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a certain man was sick, Lazarus from Bethany, the village of Mary and her sister Martha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now it was Mary who anointed the Lord with perfumed oil and wiped his feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the sisters sent word to him, saying, “Lord, behold, the one whom you love is sick.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he heard it, Jesus said, “This sickness is not to death, but for the glory of God, in order that the Son of God may be glorified through it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when he heard that he was sick, then he remained in the place where he was two days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after this he said to the disciples, “Let us go to Judea again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples said to him, “Rabbi, the Jews were seeking just now to stone you, and are you going there again?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, Are there not twelve hours in the day? If anyone walks around in the daylight, he does not stumble, because he sees the light of this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone walks around in the night, he stumbles, because the light is not in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said these things, and after this he said to them, “Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep, but I am going so that I can awaken him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the disciples said to him, “Lord, if he has fallen asleep, he will get well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now Jesus had been speaking about his death, but they thought that he was speaking about real sleep.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus then said to them plainly, “Lazarus has died,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I am glad for your sake that I was not there, so that you may believe. But let us go to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Thomas (the one who is called Didymus) said to his fellow disciples, “Let us go also, so that we may die with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when he arrived, Jesus found he had already been four days in the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about fifteen stadia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So many of the Jews came to Martha and Mary in order to console them concerning their brother.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Martha, when she heard that Jesus was coming, went to meet him, but Mary was sitting in the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even now I know that whatever you ask God, God will grant you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Your brother will rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Martha said to him, “I know that he will rise again in the resurrection at the last day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. The one who believes in me, even if he dies, will live,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and everyone who lives and believes in me will never die forever. Do you believe this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to him, “Yes, Lord, I have believed that you are the Christ, the Son of God, who comes into the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she had said this, she went and called her sister Mary privately, saying, “The Teacher is here and is calling for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that one, when she heard it, got up quickly and went to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now Jesus has not yet come into the village, but was still in the place where Martha went to meet him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jews who were with her in the house and were consoling her, when they saw Mary—that she stood up quickly and went out—followed her, because they thought that she was going to the tomb in order to weep there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Mary, when she came where Jesus was and saw him, fell at his feet, saying to him, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, when he saw her weeping and the Jews who came with her weeping, was deeply moved in spirit and was troubled within himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Where have you laid him?” They said to him, “Lord, come and see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jews were saying, “See how he loved him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them said, “Was not this man who opened the eyes of the blind able to do something so that this man also would not have died?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, deeply moved within himself again, came to the tomb. Now it was a cave, and a stone was lying on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Take away the stone.” Martha, the sister of the one who had died, said to him, “Lord, he is stinking already, because it has been four days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Did I not say to you that if you believed, you would see the glory of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took away the stone. And Jesus lifted up his eyes above and said, “Father, I give thanks to you that you hear me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I know that you always hear me, but for the sake of the crowd standing around I said it, so that they may believe that you sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had said these things, he cried out with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who had died came out, his feet and his hands bound with strips of cloth, and his face wrapped with a facecloth. Jesus said to them, “Untie him and let him go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then many of the Jews who had come with Mary and saw the things which he did believed in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them went to the Pharisees and told them the things which Jesus had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the chief priests and the Pharisees called together the Sanhedrin and said, “What are we doing? For this man is performing many signs!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we allow him to go on in this way, everyone will believe in him, and the Romans will come and take away both our place and our nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a certain one of them, Caiaphas (who was high priest in that year), said to them, “You do not know anything at all!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor do you consider that it is profitable for you that one man should die for the people, and the whole nation not perish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now he did not say this from himself, but being high priest in that year, he prophesied that Jesus was going to die for the nation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not for the nation only, but also that the children of God who are scattered would be gathered into one.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So from that day they resolved that they should kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus was no longer walking openly among the Jews, but went away from there to the region near the wilderness, to a city called Ephraim, and there he stayed with the disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Passover of the Jews was near, and many went up to Jerusalem from the surrounding country before the Passover, so that they could purify themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they were looking for Jesus, and were speaking with one another while standing in the temple courts, “What do you think? That he will not come to the feast?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had given orders that if anyone knew where he was, they should report it, in order that they could arrest him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus was, whom Jesus had raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they made him a dinner there, and Martha was serving, but Lazarus was one of the ones reclining at table with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Mary took a pound of ointment of very valuable genuine nard and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair. And the house was filled with the fragrance of the ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator
