verses.text: But Judas Iscariot, one of his disciples (the one who was going to betray him) said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why was this ointment not sold for three hundred denarii and given to the poor?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now he said this not because he was concerned about the poor, but because he was a thief, and having the money box, he used to steal what was put into it.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said, “Leave her alone, so that she may keep it for the day of my preparation for burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have the poor with you always, but you do not always have me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a large crowd of Jews found out that he was there, and they came, not only because of Jesus, but so that they could see Lazarus also, whom he raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the chief priests decided that they would kill Lazarus also,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because on account of him many of the Jews were going and believing in Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day the large crowd who had come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
took the branches of palm trees and went out to meet him, and began crying out,
“Hosanna!
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord,
even the king of Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus found a young donkey and sat on it, just as it is written,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do not be afraid, daughter of Zion!
Behold, your king is coming,
seated on the foal of a donkey!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (His disciples did not understand these things at first, but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things had been written about him and they did these things to him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the crowd who was with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead were continuing to testify.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this also the crowd went to meet him, for they had heard that he had performed this sign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Pharisees said to one another, “You see that you are accomplishing nothing! Behold, the world has gone after him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now some Greeks were among those who had gone up in order to worship at the feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So these approached Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, and began asking him saying, “Sir, we want to see Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip went and told Andrew. Andrew and Philip went and told Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered them, saying, “The hour has come that the Son of Man will be glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, unless a grain of wheat falls into the earth and dies, it remains by itself alone. But if it dies, it bears much fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who loves his life loses it, and the one who hates his life in this world preserves it for eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone serves me, he must follow me, and where I am, there my servant will be also. If anyone serves me, the Father will honor him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now my soul is troubled, and what shall I say? ‘Father, deliver me from this hour’? But for this reason I have come to this hour!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Father, glorify your name!” Then a voice came from heaven, “I have both glorified it, and I will glorify it again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the crowd that stood there and heard it said it had thundered. Others were saying, “An angel has spoken to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said, “This voice has not happened for my sake, but for your sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now is the judgment of this world! Now the ruler of this world will be thrown out!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I, when I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now he said this to indicate by what sort of death he was going to die.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the crowd replied to him, “We have heard from the law that the Christ remains forever! And how do you say that the Son of Man must be lifted up? Who is this Son of Man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to them, “Yet a little time the light is with you! Walk while you have the light, so that the darkness does not overtake you! And the one who walks in the darkness does not know where he is going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While you have the light, believe in the light, in order that you may become sons of light.” Jesus said these things, and then he went away and was hidden from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as many signs as he had performed before them, they did not believe in him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in order that the word of the prophet Isaiah would be fulfilled, who said,
“Lord, who has believed our message?
    And to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason they were not able to believe, because again Isaiah said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He has blinded their eyes
    and hardened their hearts,
lest they see with their eyes
    and understand with their hearts
and turn, and I heal them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaiah said these things because he saw his glory, and he spoke about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet despite that, even many of the rulers believed in him, but because of the Pharisees they did not confess it, so that they would not be expelled from the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they loved the praise of men more than praise from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus cried out and said, “The one who believes in me does not believe in me, but in the one who sent me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the one who sees me sees the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have come as a light into the world, in order that everyone who believes in me will not remain in the darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if anyone hears my words and does not observe them, I will not judge him. For I have not come to judge the world, but to save the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who rejects me and does not accept my words has one who judges him; the word that I have spoken will judge him on the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have not spoken from myself, but the Father himself who sent me has commanded me what I should say and what I should speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I know that his commandment is eternal life. So the things that I say, just as the Father said to me, thus I say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now before the feast of Passover, Jesus, knowing that his hour had come that he would depart from this world to the Father, and having loved his own in the world, loved them to the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as a dinner was taking place, when the devil had already put into the heart of Judas son of Simon Iscariot that he should betray him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he knew that the Father had given him all things into his hands, and that he had come forth from God and was going away to God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he got up from the dinner and took off his outer clothing, and taking a towel, tied it around himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he poured water into the washbasin and began to wash the feet of the disciples, and to wipe them dry with the towel which he had tied around himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came to Simon Peter. He said to him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to him, “What I am doing you do not understand now, but you will understand after these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to him, “You will never wash my feet forever!” Jesus replied to him, “Unless I wash you, you do not have a share with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “The one who has bathed only needs to wash his feet, but is completely clean. And you are clean, but not all of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For he knew the one who would betray him; because of this he said, “Not all of you are clean.”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when he had washed their feet and taken his outer clothing and reclined at table again, he said to them, “Do you understand what I have done for you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and you speak correctly, for I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then I—your Lord and Teacher—wash your feet, you also ought to wash one another’s feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have given you an example, that just as I have done for you, you also do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, a slave is not greater than his master, nor a messenger greater than the one who sent him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you understand these things, you are blessed if you do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am not speaking about all of you. I know whom I have chosen, but in order that the scripture would be fulfilled, ‘The one who eats my bread has lifted up his heel against me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From now on I am telling you before it happens, in order that when it happens you may believe that I am he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, the one who receives anyone I send receives me, and the one who receives me receives the one who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had said these things, Jesus was troubled in spirit and testified and said, “Truly, truly I say to you that one of you will betray me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples began looking at one another, uncertain about whom he was speaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of his disciples—the one whom Jesus loved—was reclining close beside Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Simon Peter gestured for this one to inquire who it was about whom he was speaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He leaned back accordingly against Jesus’ chest and said to him, “Lord, who is it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “It is he to whom I dip the piece of bread and give it to him.” Then after dipping the piece of bread, he gave it to Judas son of Simon Iscariot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the piece of bread, then Satan entered into him. Then Jesus said to him, “What you are doing, do quickly!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now no one of those reclining at table knew for what reason he said this to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For some were thinking because Judas had the money box, Jesus was telling him, “Purchase what we need for the feast,” or that he should give something to the poor.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after he had taken the piece of bread, he went out immediately. And it was night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, when he had gone out, Jesus said, “Now the Son of Man is glorified, and God is glorified in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If God is glorified in him, God will also glorify him in himself, and will glorify him immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Children, yet a little time I am with you. You will seek me and just as I said to the Jews, “Where I am going you cannot come,” now I say also to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A new commandment I give to you: that you love one another—just as I have loved you, that you also love one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By this everyone will know that you are my disciples—if you have love for one another.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, where are you going?” Jesus replied, “Where I am going you cannot follow me now, but you will follow later.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to him, “Lord, why am I not able to follow you now? I will lay down my life for you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Will you lay down your life for me? Truly, truly I say to you, the rooster will not crow until you have denied me three times!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not let your hearts be troubled. You believe in God; believe also in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In my Father’s house there are many dwelling places; but if not, I would have told you, because I am going away to prepare a place for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again and receive you to myself, so that where I am, you may be also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you know the way where I am going.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas said to him, “Lord, we do not know where you are going. How are we able to know the way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you had known me, you would have known my Father also. From now on you know him and have seen him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip said to him, “Lord, show us the Father, and it is enough for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Am I with you so long a time and you have not known me, Philip? The one who has seen me has seen the Father! How can you say, ‘Show us the Father?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not believe that I am in the Father and the Father is in me? The words that I say to you I do not speak from myself, but the Father residing in me does his works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Believe me that I am in the Father and the Father is in me; but if not, believe because of the works themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, the one who believes in me, the works that I am doing he will do also, and he will do greater works than these because I am going to the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever you ask in my name, I will do this, in order that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you ask me anything in my name, I will do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you love me, you will keep my commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Advocate, in order that he may be with you forever—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Spirit of truth, whom the world is not able to receive, because it does not see him or know him. You know him, because he resides with you and will be in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will not leave you as orphans; I am coming to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet a little time and the world will see me no longer, but you will see me; because I live, you also will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day you will know that I am in my Father, and you are in me, and I am in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who has my commandments and keeps them—that one is the one who loves me. And the one who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I will love him and will reveal myself to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas (not Iscariot) said to him, “Lord, why is it that you are going to reveal yourself to us and not to the world?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to him, “If anyone loves me he will keep my word, and my Father will love him, and we will come to him and will take up residence with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who does not love me does not keep my words, and the word that you hear is not mine, but the Father’s who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things I have spoken to you while residing with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Advocate, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name—that one will teach you all things, and will remind you of everything that I said to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Peace I leave with you; my peace I give to you—not as the world gives, I give to you. Do not let your hearts be troubled, and do not let them be afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have heard that I said to you, ‘I am going away, and I am coming to you.’ If you loved me, you would have rejoiced that I am going to the Father, because the Father is greater than I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now I have told you before it happens, so that when it happens, you may believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will no longer speak much with you, for the ruler of the world is coming, and he has no power over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But so that the world may know that I love the Father, and just as the Father has commanded me, thus I am doing. Get up, let us go from here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the true vine, and my Father is the vinedresser.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every branch that does not bear fruit in me, he removes it, and every branch that bears fruit, he prunes it in order that it may bear more fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are already clean because of the word that I have spoken to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remain in me, and I in you. Just as the branch is not able to bear fruit from itself unless it remains in the vine, so neither can you, unless you remain in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the vine; you are the branches. The one who remains in me and I in him—this one bears much fruit, for apart from me you are not able to do anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone does not remain in me, he is thrown out as a branch, and dries up, and they gather them and throw them into the fire, and they are burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you remain in me and my words remain in you, ask whatever you want and it will be done for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My Father is glorified by this: that you bear much fruit, and prove to be my disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Just as the Father has loved me, I also have loved you. Remain in my love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you keep my commandments, you will remain in my love, just as I have kept my Father’s commandments and remain in his love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have spoken these things to you in order that my joy may be in you, and your joy may be made complete.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is my commandment: that you love one another just as I have loved you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one has greater love than this: that someone lay down his life for his friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are my friends if you do what I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No longer do I call you slaves, because the slave does not know what his master is doing. But I have called you friends, because everything that I have heard from my Father I have revealed to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You did not choose me, but I chose you and appointed you that you should go and bear fruit, and your fruit should remain, in order that whatever you ask the Father in my name he will give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things I command you: that you love one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the world hates you, you know that it has hated me before it hated you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you were of the world, the world would love its own. But because you are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world, for this reason the world hates you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember the word that I said to you: ‘A slave is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted me, they will also persecute you. If they kept my word, they will keep yours also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they will do all these things to you on account of my name, because they do not know the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have sin. But now they do not have a valid excuse for their sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who hates me hates my Father also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I had not done among them the works that no one else did, they would not have sin. But now they have both seen and hated both me and my Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this happened so that the word that is written in their law would be fulfilled, ‘They hated me without a reason.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Advocate comes, whom I will send to you from the Father—the Spirit of truth, who proceeds from the Father—that one will testify about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you also will testify, because you have been with me from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have said these things to you so that you will not fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will expel you from the synagogue, but an hour is coming that everyone who kills you will think they are offering service to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will do these things because they do not know the Father or me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I have said these things to you so that when their hour comes, you may remember that I told you about them.
“And I have not said these things to you from the beginning, because I was with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now I am going away to the one who sent me, and none of you is asking me, ‘Where are you going?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because I have said these things to you, sorrow has filled your hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you the truth, it is better for you that I go away. For if I do not go away, the Advocate will not come to you; but if I go, I will send him to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he comes, he will convict the world concerning sin and concerning righteousness and concerning judgment:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: concerning sin, because they do not believe in me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and concerning righteousness, because I am going away to the Father and you will see me no more,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and concerning judgment, because the ruler of this world has been condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I still have many things to say to you, but you are not able to bear them now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he—the Spirit of truth—comes, he will guide you into all the truth. For he will not speak from himself, but whatever he hears he will speak, and he will proclaim to you the things to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will glorify me, because he will take from what is mine and will proclaim it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything that the Father has is mine. For this reason I said that he takes from what is mine and will proclaim it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A little while and you will see me no more, and again a little while and you will see me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So some of his disciples said to one another, “What is this that he is saying to us, ‘A little while and you will not see me, and again a little while and you will see me,’ and ‘Because I am going away to the Father’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they kept on saying, “What is this that he is saying, ‘A little while’? We do not understand what he is speaking about!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew that they were wanting to ask him, and he said to them, “Are you deliberating with one another about this—that I said, ‘A little while, and you will not see me, and again a little while and you will see me’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, that you will weep and lament, but the world will rejoice; you will become sorrowful, but your sorrow will change to joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman, when she gives birth, experiences pain because her hour has come. But when her child is born, she no longer remembers the affliction, on account of the joy that a human being has been born into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you also are experiencing sorrow now, but I will see you again, and your hearts will rejoice, and no one will take away your joy from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on that day you will ask me nothing. Truly, truly I say to you, whatever you ask the Father in my name, he will give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Until now you have asked nothing in my name. Ask and you will receive, so that your joy may be complete.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have said these things to you in figurative sayings. An hour is coming when I will speak to you in figurative sayings no longer, but I will tell you plainly about the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day you will ask in my name, and I do not say to you that I will ask the Father on your behalf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me and have believed that I came from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have gone out from the Father and have come into the world; again, I am leaving the world and am going to the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples said, “Behold, now you are speaking plainly and are telling us no figurative saying!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we know that you know everything and do not need for anyone to ask you questions. By this we believe that you have come from God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied to them, “Now do you believe?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, an hour is coming—and has come—that you will be scattered each one to his own home, and you will leave me alone. And I am not alone, because the Father is with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have said these things to you so that in me you may have peace. In the world you have affliction, but have courage! I have conquered the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said these things, and lifting up his eyes to heaven he said, “Father, the hour has come! Glorify your Son, in order that your Son may glorify you—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as you have given him authority over all flesh, in order that he would give eternal life to them—everyone whom you have given him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is eternal life: that they know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have glorified you on earth by completing the work that you have given me to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, Father, you glorify me at your side with the glory that I had at your side before the world existed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have revealed your name to the men whom you gave me out of the world. They were yours, and you have given them to me, and they have kept your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they understand that all the things that you have given me are from you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the words that you gave to me I have given to them, and they received them and know truly that I have come from you, and they have believed that you have sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am asking on behalf of them. I am not asking on behalf of the world, but on behalf of those whom you have given me, because they are yours,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all my things are yours, and your things are mine, and I have been glorified in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I am no longer in the world, and they are in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, keep them in your name, which you have given to me, so that they may be one, just as we are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I was with them, I kept them in your name, which you have given to me, and guarded them, and none of them has perished except the son of destruction, in order that the scripture would be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now I am coming to you, and I am saying these things in the world so that they may have my joy completed in themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given them your word, and the world has hated them, because they are not of the world just as I am not of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not ask that you take them out of the world, but that you protect them from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sanctify them in the truth—your word is truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as you sent me into the world, I also have sent them into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for them I sanctify myself, so that they themselves also may be sanctified in the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I do not ask on behalf of these only, but also on behalf of those who believe in me through their word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that they all may be one, just as you, Father, are in me and I am in you, that they also may be in us, in order that the world may believe that you sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the glory that you have given to me, I have given to them, in order that they may be one, just as we are one—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I in them, and you in me, in order that they may be completed in one, so that the world may know that you sent me, and you have loved them just as you have loved me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Father, those whom you have given to me—I want that those also may be with me where I am, in order that they may see my glory that you have given me because you loved me before the foundation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Righteous Father, although the world does not know you, yet I have known you, and these men have come to know that you sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I made known to them your name, and will make it known, in order that the love with which you loved me may be in them, and I may be in them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had said these things, he went out with his disciples to the other side of the ravine of the Kidron, where there was a garden into which he and his disciples entered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now Judas, the one who betrayed him, also knew about the place, because Jesus often gathered there with his disciples.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Judas, taking the cohort and officers from the chief priests and from the Pharisees, came there with lanterns and torches and weapons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, because he knew all the things that were coming upon him, went out and said to them, “Who are you looking for?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They replied to him, “Jesus the Nazarene.” He said to them, “I am he.” (Now Judas, the one who betrayed him, was also standing with them.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when he said to them, “I am he,” they drew back and fell to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he asked them again, “Who are you looking for?” And they said, “Jesus the Nazarene.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I said to you that I am he! So if you are looking for me, let these men go,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order that the word that he had spoken would be fulfilled: “Those whom you have given to me—I have not lost anyone of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it and struck the slave of the high priest and cut off his right ear. (Now the name of the slave was Malchus.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to Peter, “Put the sword into its sheath! The cup that the Father has given me—shall I not drink it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the cohort and the military tribune and the officers of the Jews seized Jesus and tied him up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and brought him to Annas first, for he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now it was Caiaphas who had advised the Jews that it was better that one man die for the people.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Simon Peter and another disciple followed Jesus. (Now that disciple was known to the high priest, and entered with Jesus into the courtyard of the high priest.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter was standing by the door outside. So the other disciple who was known to the high priest went out and spoke to the doorkeeper and brought Peter in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the female slave who was the doorkeeper said to Peter, “You are not also one of the disciples of this man, are you?” He said, “I am not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now the slaves and the officers were standing there, having made a charcoal fire because it was cold, and they were warming themselves. And Peter was also standing there with them and warming himself.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the high priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and about his teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied to him, “I have spoken openly to the world. I always taught in the synagogue and in the temple courts where all the Jews assemble, and I have said nothing in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why are you asking me? Ask those who heard what I have said to them! Behold, these people know what I said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he had said these things, one of the officers who was standing by gave a slap in the face to Jesus, saying, “Do you reply to the high priest in this way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied to him, “If I have spoken wrongly, testify about what is wrong! But if I have spoken correctly, why do you strike me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Annas sent him, tied up, to Caiaphas the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Simon Peter was standing there and warming himself. So they said to him, “You are not also one of his disciples, are you?” He denied it and said, “I am not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the slaves of the high priest, who was related to the one whose ear Peter had cut off, said, “Did I not see you in the garden with him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter denied it again, and immediately a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought Jesus from Caiaphas to the governor’s residence. Now it was early, and they did not enter into the governor’s residence so that they would not be defiled, but could eat the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate came outside to them and said, “What accusation do you bring against this man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered and said to him, “If this man were not doing evil, we would not have handed him over to you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate said to them, “You take him and judge him according to your law!” The Jews said to him, “It is not permitted for us to kill anyone,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order that the word of Jesus would be fulfilled that he had spoken, indicating by what sort of death he was going to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate entered again into the governor’s residence and summoned Jesus and said to him, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Do you say this from yourself, or have others said this to you about me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate replied, “I am not a Jew, am I? Your people and the chief priests handed you over to me! What have you done?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “My kingdom is not of this world. If my kingdom were of this world, my servants would be fighting so that I would not be handed over to the Jews. But now my kingdom is not from here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said to him, “So then you are a king!” Jesus replied, “You say that I am a king. For this reason I was born, and for this reason I have come into the world: in order that I can testify to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth hears my voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate said to him, “What is truth?”
And when he had said this, he went out again to the Jews and said to them, “I find no basis for an accusation against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is your custom that I release for you one prisoner at the Passover. So do you want me to release for you the king of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they shouted again, saying, “Not this man, but Barabbas!” (Now Barabbas was a revolutionary.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then Pilate took Jesus and had him flogged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the soldiers wove a crown of thorns and placed it on his head, and put a purple robe on him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and were coming up to him and saying, “Hail, king of the Jews!” and were giving him slaps in the face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate came outside again and said to them, “Behold, I am bringing him outside to you, so that you will know that I find no basis for an accusation against him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came outside wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe, and he said to them, “Behold the man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they saw him, the chief priests and the officers shouted, saying, “Crucify! Crucify!” Pilate said to them, “You take him and crucify him! For I do not find a basis for an accusation against him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews replied to him, “We have a law, and according to the law he ought to die, because he made himself out to be the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Pilate heard this statement, he was even more afraid,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he entered into the governor’s residence again and said to Jesus, “Where are you from?” But Jesus did not give him an answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate said to him, “Will you not speak to me? Do you not know that I have authority to release you, and I have authority to crucify you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied to him, “You would not have any authority over me unless it was given to you from above. For this reason the one who handed me over to you has greater sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From this point on Pilate was seeking to release him, but the Jews shouted, saying, “If you release this man, you are not a friend of Caesar! Everyone who makes himself out to be a king opposes Caesar!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate, when he heard these words, brought Jesus outside and sat down on the judgment seat, in the place called The Stone Pavement (but Gabbatha in Aramaic).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now it was the day of preparation of the Passover; it was about the sixth hour.) And he said to the Jews, “Behold your king!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those shouted, “Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!” Pilate said to them, “Shall I crucify your king?” The chief priests replied, “We do not have a king except Caesar!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So then he handed him over to them in order that he could be crucified.
So they took Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and carrying for himself the cross, he went out to the place called The Place of a Skull (which is called Golgotha in Aramaic),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where they crucified him, and with him two others, one on each side, and Jesus in the middle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate also wrote a notice and placed it on the cross, and it was written: “Jesus the Nazarene, the king of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So many of the Jews read this notice, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city. And it was written in Aramaic, in Latin, and in Greek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, “Do not write ‘The king of the Jews,’ but, ‘He said, I am king of the Jews.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate replied, “What I have written, I have written.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his clothing and made four shares—for each soldier a share—and the tunic. (Now the tunic was seamless, woven from the top in a single piece.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they said to one another, “Let us not tear it apart, but cast lots for it, to see whose it will be,” so that the scripture would be fulfilled that says,
“They divided my garments among themselves,
    and for my clothing they cast lots.”
Thus the soldiers did these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now his mother and the sister of his mother, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene were standing near the cross of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus, seeing his mother and the disciple whom he loved standing there, said to his mother, “Woman, behold your son!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to the disciple, “Behold your mother!” And from that hour the disciple took her into his own home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Jesus, knowing that now at last everything was completed, in order that the scripture would be fulfilled, said, “I am thirsty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A jar full of sour wine was standing there, so they put a sponge full of the sour wine on a branch of hyssop and brought it to his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when he had received the sour wine, Jesus said, “It is completed,” and bowing his head, he gave up his spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews, because it was the day of preparation, so that the bodies would not remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was an important day), asked Pilate that their legs could be broken and they could be taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and of the other who had been crucified with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they came to Jesus, after they saw he was already dead, they did not break his legs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and blood and water came out immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who has seen it has testified, and his testimony is true, and that person knows that he is telling the truth, so that you also may believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these things happened in order that the scripture would be fulfilled: “Not a bone of his will be broken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again another scripture says, “They will look on the one whom they have pierced.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after these things, Joseph who was from Arimathea, who was a disciple of Jesus (but a secret one for fear of the Jews), asked Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus. And Pilate allowed it, so he came and took away his body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nicodemus—the one who had come to him formerly at night—also came, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes weighing about a hundred pounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took the body of Jesus and wrapped it in strips of linen cloth with the fragrant spices, as is the Jews’ custom to prepare for burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a garden at the place where he was crucified, and in the garden a new tomb in which no one was yet buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there, on account of the day of preparation of the Jews, because the tomb was close by, they buried Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene came to the tomb early, while it was still dark, and saw the stone had been taken away from the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she ran and came to Simon Peter and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved and said to them, “They have taken away the Lord from the tomb and we do not know where they have put him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter and the other disciple went out and were going to the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the two were running together, and the other disciple ran ahead, faster than Peter, and came to the tomb first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And bending over to look, he saw the strips of linen cloth lying there, though he did not go in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon Peter also came following him, and he went into the tomb and saw the strips of linen cloth lying there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the facecloth that was on his head—not lying with the strips of linen cloth, but folded up separately in one place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then the other disciple who had come to the tomb first also went in, and he saw and believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For they did not yet know the scripture that it was necessary for him to rise from the dead.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples went away again to their own homes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Mary stood outside at the tomb, weeping. Then, while she was weeping, she bent over to look into the tomb,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she saw two angels in white, seated one at the head and one at the feet where the body of Jesus had been lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” She said to them, “They have taken away my Lord, and I do not know where they have put him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she had said these things, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, and she did not know that it was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Who are you looking for?” She thought that it was the gardener, and said to him, “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have put him, and I will take him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Mary.” She turned around and said to him in Aramaic, “Rabboni” (which means “Teacher”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Do not touch me, for I have not yet ascended to the Father. But go to my brothers and tell them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, and my God and your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary Magdalene came and announced to the disciples, “I have seen the Lord,” and he had said these things to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when it was evening on that day—the first day of the week—and the doors had been shut where the disciples were because of fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in their midst and said to them, “Peace to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had said this, he showed his hands and his side to them. Then the disciples rejoiced when they saw the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to them again, “Peace to you. As the Father has sent me, I also send you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had said this, he breathed on them and said to them, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you forgive the sins of any, they are forgiven them. If you retain the sins of any, they are retained.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Thomas, one of the twelve, who was called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the other disciples said to him, “We have seen the Lord!” But he said to them, “Unless I see in his hands the mark of the nails, and put my finger into the mark of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will never believe!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after eight days his disciples were again inside, and Thomas with them. Although the doors had been shut, Jesus came and stood in their midst and said, “Peace to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to Thomas, “Place your finger here and see my hands, and place your hand and put it into my side. And do not be unbelieving, but believing!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas answered and said to him, “My Lord and my God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Because you have seen me, have you believed? Blessed are those who have not seen and have believed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus also performed many other signs in the presence of the disciples which are not recorded in this book,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but these things are recorded in order that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things Jesus revealed himself again to the disciples by the Sea of Tiberias. Now he revealed himself in this way:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter and Thomas (who was called Didymus) and Nathanael from Cana in Galilee and the sons of Zebedee and two others of his disciples were together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter said to them, “I am going fishing!” They said to him, “We also are coming with you.” They went out and got into the boat, and during that night they caught nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when it was already early morning, Jesus stood on the beach. However, the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to them, “Children, you do not have any fish to eat, do you? They answered him, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Throw the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.” So they threw it, and were no longer able to haul it in from the large number of the fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then that disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” So Simon Peter, when he heard that it was the Lord, tied around himself his outer garment (for he was naked) and threw himself into the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the other disciples came in the boat, dragging the net of fish, because they were not far from the land, but about two hundred cubits away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they got out on the land, they saw a charcoal fire laid there, and a fish lying on it, and bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish that you have just now caught.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Simon Peter got into the boat and hauled the net to the land, full of large fish—one hundred fifty-three—and although there were so many, the net was not torn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Come, eat breakfast!” But none of the disciples dared to ask him, “Who are you?” because they knew that it was the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them, and the fish likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was now the third time Jesus was revealed to the disciples after he had been raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they had eaten breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon son of John, do you love me more than these?” He said to him, “Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.” He said to him, “Feed my lambs!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him again a second time, “Simon son of John, do you love me?” He said to him, “Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.” He said to him, “Shepherd my sheep!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him a third time, “Simon son of John, do you love me?” Peter was distressed because he said to him a third time, “Do you love me?” and he said to him, “Lord, you know everything! You know that I love you!” Jesus said to him, “Feed my sheep!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, truly I say to you, when you were young, you tied your clothes around yourself and walked wherever you wanted. But when you grow old, you will stretch out your hands, and someone else will tie you up and carry you where you do not want to go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now he said this to indicate by what kind of death he would glorify God.) And after he had said this, he said to him, “Follow me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter turned and saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following them (who also leaned back on his chest at the dinner and said, “Lord, who is the one betraying you?”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when he saw this one, Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, but what about this one?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “If I want him to remain until I come, what is that to you? You follow me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So this saying went out to the brothers that that disciple would not die. But Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but “If I want him to remain until I come, what is that to you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the disciple who is testifying about these things, and who has written down these things. And we know that his testimony is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there are also many other things that Jesus did, which—if they were written down one after the other—I suppose not even the world itself could contain the books that would be written.
verses.speaker: Narrator
